a: Stemming reduces words to a rough base form (e.g., 'running' -> 'run'), sometimes producing non-words.
Lemmatization reduces words to a dictionary form (lemma) using linguistic rules (e.g., 'better' -> 'good').
TF-IDF weights words by how important they are: frequent in a document but rare across documents.
Bag-of-words represents text by word counts, ignoring grammar and word order.
Sentiment analysis classifies text as positive/negative/neutral (or more detailed emotions).

q: Give me tips for writing an NLP essay
a: Explain your method, justify design choices, include examples, evaluate limitations, and reflect on UX and ethics.
